item.title: BAE Systems Strong Orders Underpin Outlook
item.description: BAE Systems said its order intake was over £30 billion booked in the year to date, and reiterated its guidance for the year.

item.title: Nikkei Edges Up 0.1%, Helped by Food, Financial Stocks
item.description: The Nikkei Stock Average closed 0.1% higher at 32585.11 as gains in food and financial stocks helped offset losses caused by several disappointing earnings.

item.title: Major Australian Ports Reopen After Cyberattack Halts Operations
item.description: Four terminals handling nearly 40% of the country’s imports had been offline since Friday.

item.title: Origin's Largest Shareholder Turns Down Chance to Join Takeover Consortium
item.description: Origin Energy’s largest shareholder said it rejected an offer to join the Brookfield Asset Management-led consortium trying to buy the Australian power retailer and generator.

item.title: Fitch to Withdraw Ratings on Country Garden Services
item.description: Fitch Ratings will withdraw all ratings on Country Garden Services next month, a move that comes months after it downgraded the sister company of Chinese property giant Country Garden Holdings.

item.title: China's Spending on Green Energy Is Causing a Global Glut
item.description: The country’s massive funding of renewables has drawn odd newcomers and led to an oversupply of solar components.

item.title: Israel said it was pressuring Hamas to surrender its position inside Gaza's largest hospital as it engaged in intense fighting with militants that left thousands of displaced people stuck inside the complex with dwindling medical supplies, water and food.
item.description: Israel said it was pressuring Hamas to surrender its position inside Gaza’s largest hospital as it engaged in intense fighting with militants that left thousands of displaced people stuck inside the complex with dwindling medical supplies, water and food.

item.title: The transition to green energy is becoming more problematic while the oil-and-gas industry is embarking on a round of megadeals enabled by soaring profits.
item.description: The transition to green energy is becoming more problematic while the oil-and-gas industry is embarking on a round of megadeals enabled by soaring profits.

item.title: Former FTX executives, including one who served as a key witness against Samuel Bankman-Fried, are teaming up to build a new cryptocurrency exchange that aims to solve the problems that doomed their previous employer.
item.description: Former FTX executives, including one who served as a key witness against Samuel Bankman-Fried, are teaming up to build a new cryptocurrency exchange that aims to solve the problems that doomed their previous employer.

item.title: "The Marvels," Disney's latest superhero feature, landed with a thud at the box office only days after Chief Executive Bob Iger announced an ambitious overhaul of the entertainment giant's studio business.
item.description: “The Marvels,” Disney’s latest superhero feature, landed with a thud at the box office only days after Chief Executive Bob Iger announced an ambitious overhaul of the entertainment giant’s studio business.

item.title: Investors are betting the recent stock market rally has legs after a lightning-fast rebound drove the index up around 7% over the past two weeks, , its best stretch of the year. Bulls are piling into funds that track U.S. shares and abandoning trades that would profit in times of market turmoil.
item.description: Investors are betting the recent stock market rally has legs after a lightning-fast rebound drove the index up around 7% over the past two weeks, , its best stretch of the year. Bulls are piling into funds that track U.S. shares and abandoning trades that would profit in times of market turmoil.

item.title: The new era of higher interest rates has reignited a debate over whether it is better for ordinary investors to buy individual bonds outright or through shares of bond mutual funds.
item.description: The new era of higher interest rates has reignited a debate over whether it is better for ordinary investors to buy individual bonds outright or through shares of bond mutual funds.

item.title: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel rebuffed calls from the U.S. and some Arab leaders for the Palestinian Authority to govern Gaza after the war ends, deepening the divergence between Israel and the U.S. on a postwar plan for the enclave.
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel rebuffed calls from the U.S. and some Arab leaders for the Palestinian Authority to govern Gaza after the war ends, deepening the divergence between Israel and the U.S. on a postwar plan for the enclave.

item.title: The latest iteration and first international installment of the NCIS franchise, "NCIS: Sydney," will make its debut on CBS on Nov. 14.
item.description: The latest iteration and first international installment of the NCIS franchise, “NCIS: Sydney,” will make its debut on CBS on Nov. 14.

item.title: Canadian fashion and retailing mogul Peter Nygard was found guilty in a Toronto court of four counts of sexual assault, concluding a six-week-long trial.
item.description: Canadian fashion and retailing mogul Peter Nygard was found guilty in a Toronto court of four counts of sexual assault, concluding a six-week-long trial.

item.title: Pope Francis removed Bishop Joseph Strickland, one of his most vocal critics, and appointed Bishop Joe Vázquez of Austin as "apostolic administrator," or acting bishop, of Tyler, Texas.
item.description: Pope Francis removed Bishop Joseph Strickland, one of his most vocal critics, and appointed Bishop Joe Vázquez of Austin as “apostolic administrator,” or acting bishop, of Tyler, Texas.

item.title: The U.S. Army overturned the convictions of 110 Black soldiers charged more than a century ago with mutiny, murder and assault in a riot when members of the 24th Infantry Regiment clashed with police and white residents of heavily segregated Houston.
item.description: The U.S. Army overturned the convictions of 110 Black soldiers charged more than a century ago with mutiny, murder and assault in a riot when members of the 24th Infantry Regiment clashed with police and white residents of heavily segregated Houston.

item.title: Sen. Tim Scott of South Carolina suspended his Republican presidential campaign after failing to catch momentum in a crowded field dominated by former President Donald Trump.
item.description: Sen. Tim Scott of South Carolina suspended his Republican presidential campaign after failing to catch momentum in a crowded field dominated by former President Donald Trump.

item.title: House Speaker Mike Johnson unveiled a two-step short-term spending proposal that would keep money flowing to federal agencies into early next year, in a bid to stave off a partial government shutdown late next week.
item.description: House Speaker Mike Johnson unveiled a two-step short-term spending proposal that would keep money flowing to federal agencies into early next year, in a bid to stave off a partial government shutdown late next week.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: What’s News: World-Wide
